attributes.action: Enforce tougher laws on absent parents to pay child support to single parents.
attributes.additional_details: I want the government to enforce tougher laws on non residential parents to pay child support to single parents because I am a single parent of a seven year old who has not seen his father for the past six years. He is a non paying parent because he is not working and refuses to go on benefits because he does not want to pay for his child.
attributes.background: I want the government to Enforce tougher laws on non residential parents to pay child support to single parents and take parental responsibility for their children.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you want to see stronger laws in relation to non-resident parents, but it's not clear what new laws you want to see. We could accept a petition calling on the Government to increase penalties for non-payment of child maintenance, if that's what you want to happen.

We couldn't publish a petition that contained any personal information about a non-resident parent.
